output: For each test case print a line containing “Caso #X: Y”, where X is the number of the current case, starting at 1, and Y is the length of the longest contiguous sequence of exams that has the greatest arithmetic mean.
input: The first line contains an integer T (1 ≤ T ≤ 100), the number of test cases. Each test case starts with a line containing an integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 10⁵), the number of exams Guga has done in his entire academic life. The next line contains N integers Pi (0 ≤ Pi ≤ 10000), the i-th integer represents Guga’s grade in the i-th exam.
name: Estimating the Mean
description: Guga has done N exams throughout his academic life. Now that he is close to graduate from college, he wants to know what was the longest contiguous period of time in which his arithmetic mean was the greatest.
